mustNotMiss.escalationConcern: Urgent assessment for tachypnea, hypoxia, focal chest signs, or systemic toxicity.

whenHelpful.rationale: Helps detect physiological instability during consultation.
Used when findings will change immediate management.
Reserve for diagnostic uncertainty or higher risk presentations.

selfCare: Provide symptom-control advice tailored to current severity.
Confirm patient understands red-flag escalation instructions.
followUpLogic: Escalate urgently when red flags or physiological compromise are present.
Review persistent cough trajectories and trigger imaging/referral when thresholds are met.
Document explicit return precautions for worsening breathing or systemic illness.

returnAdvice: Seek urgent care for coughing blood, worsening breathlessness, or chest pain.
Seek urgent care for persistent fever, confusion, or inability to keep fluids down.
Return if cough persists beyond expected recovery or new red flags develop.
